clinical_study.brief_title: Physiopathological Study of Autonomic Failure in Parkinson's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Physiopathological Study of Autonomic Failure in Parkinson's Disease : a Monocentric Study

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to evaluate the autonomic failure in Parkinson's disease by clinical, electrophysiological and neuropathological examination.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate association between clinical autonomic failure and neuropathological autonomic failure on biopsies.
primary_outcome.description: the main objective is to look after associations between : anatomopathological signs of autonomic nervous system disorders seen on biopsies AND clinical signs of signs of autonomic nervous system disorders seen through functional tests or through symptoms indicated by the patient on questionaries.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate association between autonomic failure and severity factors in Parkinson's disease
secondary_outcome.description: Autonomic failure will be assessed through questionaries on symptoms and through functional tests. Severity factors in parkinson disease will refer to various parameters like patient age.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate consequences of autonomic failure on quality of life and sleep quality
secondary_outcome.description: quality of life and of sleep will be assessed through functional tests and through questionaries.

intervention.intervention_name: Biopsies of peripheral autonomic nervous system

intervention.other_name: a battery of questionaries to evaluate autonomic neurological patient complaints and dysfunctions.
A battery of electrophysiological tests to assess neurological functions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with Parkinson's disease
- ages 45 to 80 years, both genders
- patients who signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- autonomic function modifying treatment
- pre-existing neuropathy or risk factors for neuropathy
- dementia
- colonic disorders
- coagulation disorders (may be due to treatment)

clinical_study.keyword: Autonomic failure, Parkinson's disease, electrophysiological assessment, neuropathological assessment
